questions.uddipok:
Read the following passage and fill in each gap with a suitable word based on the information of the passage:
Fish population is in serious danger from global warming. Climate change is increasing the water temperature in rivers, lakes and seas. This means there is less food and oxygen available for fish. It also means the fish may not grow fully and may have fewer offsprings. Some fishes will become extinct if temperatures rise even by one or two degrees celsius.
Climate change increases the pressure on fish population. Fishes are one of the world's most valuable biological assets. Forty percent of people in the world eat fish as their main source of protein. If we fail to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, we will increase the pressure on fish. As a result, people who depend on fish will suffer from hunger and poverty.

Question:
It is (a) — from the passage that global warming is (b) — great threat for fish population. (c) — global warming, food production and oxygen (d) — in water decrease. As a result, some fishes may be extinct (e) ——.

Milton was a great poet after Shakespeare. His father early decided that Milton was to have a literary career. At the age of 7, in 1615 he got himself admitted in Star Palace School. But Milton could not pay attention to his studies in this school. After a couple of years, he left the school and studied at St. Paul's School till 1624. In the succeeding year, John Milton entered Christ College in Cambridge. He took his M.A degree at the age of 24 and went to his father's house in the village of Horton. Milton's father, however, had faith in his son and allowed him to continue his studies at Horton from 1632 to 1638 . During his time, he made himself master of everything worth knowing in the literature of Rome, Greece, Italy, France, Spain and the Bible. In 1643, Milton met Mary Powel in a occasion and married her. But this great poet became blind in 1652. The idea behind his famous work 'Paradise Lost' developed after his blindness. 'Paradise Lost' saw the light of the day in the year 1665. Nine years after its publications, this great artist in literature died.
Write a summary of the above passage in your own words.

sub_questions.explanation: Milton, a great poet, was born in 1608 . He studied at Star Palace School and St. Paul's School. He entered Christ College in Cambridge in 1625. He received his MA degree from this institution at the age of 24 . His father was highly optimistic about his son's potential. Milton made himself a master of the literature of Rome, Greece, Italy, France, Spain and of the Bible between 1632 and 1638 at his father's home in Horton. His great work Paradise Lost was published after his blindness in 1665. He breathed his last in 1674.

questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions to write a paragraph on 'A Book Fair':
(a) What is a book fair? (b) When and where is it held? (c) How popular is it? (d) Have you ever visitied a book fair? (e) What kind of books are usually available in a book fair?

sub_questions.explanation:
A Book Fair
A book fair is a kind of fair where different types of books are displayed for sale. Book fair is now held in every city and town too. It has recently become very popular in our country. People go to the fair to find their desired books. In Bangladesh, a book fair is arranged on the occasion of 21 s t 21^{st} 2 1 s t February, 16 th 16^{\text {th }} 1 6 th December, 26 th 26^{\text {th }} 2 6 th March and Bangla New Year. The fair is held in an open place or in auditorium or in a big hall-room. In our country, the largest book fair is held on the premises of Bangla Academy on the occasion of 21 t h 21^{th} 2 1 t h February. All kinds of books such as fiction, drama, poetry, novel, biography, translation, children literature, story books, etc. are usually available in a book fair. A book fair usually remains crowded. People from all walks of life visit the fair. People who are book lovers come to the fair to buy books and to enjoy the fair. Young boys and girls gather here to find out books of their favourite authors. They buy books to present them as gifts to their near and dear ones and for themselves. From the interest and participation of people, the popularity of book fair in our country can be realised. A book fair bears great importance. Moreover, it creates a sense of interest for books among the general people. It is really an exceptional place. It develops and flourishes our reading habits and thus makes us enlightened. It also helps develop our creativity.

questions.uddipok:
Read the beginning of a story. Add at least ten new sentences to complete the story. Give a suitable title to it.
Once there lived a poor rickshaw puller. He had to maintain his family consisting of six members with a great difficulty. He always thought of additional income for the maintenance of his family. One day while walking through the fields, he found a purse of gold dropped by a passer-by. He …..

sub_questions.explanation:
Honesty of a Rickshaw-puller
Once there lived a poor rickshaw puller. He had to maintain his family consisting of eight members with great difficulty. One day while walking through the fields, he found a purse dropped by a passer-by. He picked the purse up and found a.lot of money in it. He said, "It might be dropped by a passer-by." He looked for the owner for sometimes, but found no one. He took the bag to his home and showed it to his wife. His wife said to him, "God has given this money to us and so we should use it to remove our poor condition." The rickshaw puller said, "No, it does not belong to us. I should look for the owner." The next day, the rickshaw puller was waiting in that place where he
found the purse thinking that the owner might come in search of it. After a long time, he noticed a man looking for something. The rickshaw puller rushed to the man and came to know that the purse belonged to him. He took the man to his home and handed over the bág. The man was very pleased at the honesty of the rickshaw puller. The man was very rich and he gave the rickshaw puller a good job with high salary in his farm. The rickshaw puller and his family became pleased and they were no more in want.

questions.uddipok: The graph below show "The number of people in percentage, living below the poverty line" from 1995 to 2010. Describe the graph in 150 words. You should highlight and summarize the information given in the graph.

sub_questions.explanation: The bar chart deals with the number of people living below the poverty line in the years of 1995, 2004, 2008 and 2010. In the bar chart, the percentage of the number of people living below the poverty line is compared among four years. 35.6 percent people were living under the poverty line in 1995. Nine years later, in 2004, the number rose to 45 percent which is about 9.4 percent higher than 1995 . In 2008, fortunately the number decreased to 36.3 percent which is about 8.7 percent lower than that of four years ago. Finally, in 2010 , with a happy note the number decreased to 31.51 percent which is about 4.79 percent lower than that of 2008. So, it can be said that within the time span of 15 years the percentage of the people living below the poverty line has slightly been decreased. Though in 2008 the number rose, in the following years it decreased gradually.

questions.uddipok: Suppose, yoụ are Anuvob/Anuva. You have a pen friend named Jovan who lives in the USA. He wants to know about your country. Now, write a letter to your friend describing your country.

sub_questions.explanation:
12 Green Road, Dhaka, Bangladesh
10 January 2024
Dear Jovan,
It's really delightful to hear from you after a long time. It makes me happy that you want to know about my country.
Let's start with the geographical position of this small country. It is a South-Asian country surrounded by India on three sides and the Bay of Bengal on the south. Myanmar lies to her south-east. Its area is 1,48,460 square kilometres where about 160 million people live. So you see the density of population in our country is high. The country achieved independence in 1971 after fighting against the well-equipped Pakistani Army for nine months. We are the only nation who has the glory of fighting for its mother language. Our Language Movement took place in 1952. Bangladesh is marked as a country of beauty. There are many places of tourist attraction in Bangladesh. We have a long cultural tradition, literature, arts, etc. that are very developed and have acquired international recognition.
The people in Bangladesh are very hard-working, ready to face any obstacles. They are very hospitable. They become very happy when they have a guest at home and try their best to entertain the guest. They like to talk a lot, even to the strangers or foreigners. People here are much curious about foreigners.
Anyway, the letter is getting long. No more today. I would like to invite you to visit my country as soon as possible. Take care.

With love,
Anuvob

Suppose you are Nabil/Nabila. You have a friend called Nabeen/Nabeena. Both of you are very interested in different types of games and sports.
Now, write a dialogue between you and your friend emphasizing the importance of games and sports in our life.

sub_questions.explanation:
Nabeen/Nabeena ：Hi Nabil/Nabila, where are you heading to?
Nabil/Nabila : Hi, I'm on my way to the sports club.
Nabeen/Nabeena : What do you do there?
Nabil/Nabila : Well, I practise badminton there.
Nabeen/Nabeena : That's interesting!Do you go there often?
Nabil/Nabila : Yes, almost every day. It keeps my body and mind fit. Do you participate in any sports, Nabeen/Nabeena?
Nabeen/Nabeena : Yes, I do.
Nabil/Nabila : Which sports are you interested in?
Nabeen/Nabeena : I usually play cricket and football to keep my body fit and healthy.

Nabil/Nabila : Some people don't like physical activities. They don't realize the importance of games.

Nabeen/Nabeena : Discipline is very essential for the progress of an individual as well as the nation as a whole.

questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions:
a) Why is 21 February a memorable day in our national history?
b) Who is responsible to raise a storm of protest and how? Describe.
c) How did the Pakistani government try to prevent the protest?
d) What did the students of Dhaka University do against the declaration of outlạiving all sorts of public meetings and rallies?
e) How is Language Movement related to Independence Movement of Bángladesh?

sub_questions.explanation:
a. February 21 is a memorable day in our national history because on this day in 1952, the heroic son's of Bengal laid down their lives to establish Bangla as a state language of the undivided Pakistan. On this day, we pay tribute to the language martyrs because of their sacrifice for the rightful place of mother tongue.
b. The then Governor General of Pakistan, Mohammad Ali Zinnah, is responsible to raise a storm of protest. In a public meeting in Dhaka, he declared Urdu as the only state language of Pakistan, which disregarded the language rights of the Bangalee. Therefore, a mass protest started across the country.
c. The Pakistani government banned all sorts of public meetings and gatherings to stop the protest that began following Mohammad Ali Jinnah's declaration of Urdu as the only state language of Pakistan and continued non-stop.
d. Against the declaration of outlawing all sorts of public meeting and rallies, the students of Dhaka University brought out a peaceful protest procession on 21 February, defying the law.
e. The Language Movement of 1952 kindled the sparks of independence movement in East Pakistan by making the Bangalees aware of their rights. Thus, the Language Movement is related to the independence movement of Bangladesh.
